title: Calories in 1 Cup Raw Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup raw rice, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better meals.
assumptions: Long-grain white rice, uncooked, unenriched; 1 cup ≈ 185 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, processing, and measurement; check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 cup raw rice provides ~675 kcal, mostly from carbs, with ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp vegetable oil per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup raw rice?
faqs.a: About 675 kcal for 1 cup (185 g) long-grain white raw rice.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in 1 cup raw rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 148 g carbs, with 2.4 g fiber and minimal sugars.
Yes, ~13 g protein per cup, making it a decent plant-based source.

faqs.q: How do calories change when rice is cooked?
faqs.a: Cooked rice has fewer calories per cup (~200 kcal) due to water absorption; raw expands 3x when cooked.

faqs.q: Is brown rice lower in calories than white raw rice?
faqs.a: Similar—brown is ~684 kcal per cup, but higher in fiber (about 7 g per cup).
